sources.notes: Provides poverty headcount ratios (US$1.90, US$3.20, US$5.50 lines) and income distribution data.  Tag as “World Bank – PovcalNet”.
External debt stocks and debt service flows.
Commodities prices, remittances flows, and macro indicators used in GEM; part of WBG but requires registration.
Provides macro forecasts for GDP growth, inflation, fiscal balance; also baseline and scenario projections.
Contextual narrative on fiscal developments; includes tables of expenditure and revenue for some countries.  Ingest as documents.
Aggregated macro statistics for Arab countries; may provide monetary aggregates and inflation proxies.  *Check licensing.*
Socio-economic indicators for MENA; includes GDP, inflation, unemployment, energy.  API or bulk download available; license open with attribution.
Aggregates official and market data (CPI, FX, interest rates).  Free tier requires registration; verify data provenance.  *Check licensing.*
Official statistical yearbooks covering GDP by sector, CPI, population, education, health (up to 2014).  Ingest scanned PDFs; extract tables via OCR.  Coverage ends before conflict.

sources.nameEn: UN Population Division World Population Prospects
sources.notes: Standard demographic projections; includes fertility, mortality, migration.  Use for cross‑checking CSO and UNFPA projections.
Includes HDI, GII, and Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) for Yemen.  Ingest for context.
Ease-of-doing-business rankings, cost of starting a business, etc.  Useful for private sector context.
Survey microdata on firm characteristics, performance, business environment; requires registration.
Includes SDG indicators relevant to Yemen (poverty, health, education).

sources.nameEn: University of Sheffield Night‑Time Lights Arabia
sources.notes: Provides VIIRS night‑time lights composites aggregated by country or custom shape; used as economic proxy.  *Open data.*

sources.nameEn: World Food Programme VAM Commodity Price API
sources.notes: Provides market price data for food and fuel commodities.  Not all countries have API; check for Yemen.
Bulletins summarise staple food price trends across countries; includes Yemen; can complement WFP data.

sources.nameEn: SEMC (Yemen Studies & Economic Media Center) Price Bulletins
sources.notes: SEMC publishes price bulletins for staples (flour, fuel, gas) in Yemen’s main cities.  Integrate via PDF scraping.
Famine Early Warning Systems Network provides market price bulletins and integrated food security outlooks; includes Yemen; open data.

sources.nameEn: Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) Analysis
sources.notes: Provides classification of food insecurity phases per governorate; narrative and maps; ingest for context.

sources.nameEn: UNICEF Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) – Yemen
sources.notes: Household surveys capturing nutrition, child health, and some expenditure data.  Yemen’s last MICS in 2006; still useful for baseline.

sources.nameEn: World Health Organization Global Health Observatory
sources.notes: Provides health expenditure per capita, out‑of‑pocket spending, and health system indicators.  Use as proxy for cost of health.

sources.nameEn: Central Bank of Yemen FX Auction Archive (Aden)
sources.notes: Already in master registry; keep.
Provides country‑pair trade flows used to infer FX positions; complement Comtrade.

sources.nameEn: Bank for International Settlements (BIS) Triennial Central Bank Survey
sources.notes: Provides data on global currency trading, including USD/YER turnover if reported; low coverage; useful for context.
Shows IFC investments and advisory services in Yemen; extract investment amounts, dates, sectors.
Contains statistics on trade finance extended to Yemeni banks; good for understanding import finance availability.

sources.nameEn: World Bank Enterprise Finance Gap Database
sources.notes: Estimates financing gaps for SMEs; includes Yemen; can supplement microfinance data.
Reports and datasets on microfinance; search for Yemen; cross‑reference with YMN.

sources.nameEn: FATF (Financial Action Task Force) Grey List/Mutual Evaluation
sources.notes: Reports on Yemen’s AML/CFT compliance; relevant for banking sector risk; narrative only.

sources.nameEn: MENA Financial Inclusion Dashboard (World Bank / Arab Monetary Fund)
sources.notes: Provides indicators on access to finance, account penetration, digital payments.
Data on mobile money deployments and transaction volumes; may cover Yemen; cross‑check with mobile operators.
Analytical papers on the banking sector, bank splits, liquidity; ingest as documents.
Global ranking of corruption perceptions; includes Yemen; used to benchmark governance environment.

sources.nameEn: World Bank BOOST Public Finance Database
sources.notes: Contains government expenditure and revenue data by sector for some countries; check if Yemen pre‑2014 data exists.
Scores budget transparency, participation and oversight; Yemen scored 0 in recent years.
Donor funding by sector/project; includes aid flows to Yemen not captured in FTS.

sources.nameEn: UN General Assembly Resolutions & Security Council Resolutions
sources.notes: Provide official sanction mandates, budget authorisations for UN missions; treat as legal documents; link to events.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Port Authority & UNVIM Import Reports
sources.notes: Data on fuel and food shipments through Hodeidah, Salif and Ras Isa ports; used as trade and supply proxies.
Reports on Yemen’s budget process and transparency; narrative.

sources.nameEn: Tax Justice Network Financial Secrecy Index
sources.notes: Provides ranking of secrecy jurisdictions; Yemen may be included; used for context.

sources.nameEn: United Nations Panel of Experts on Yemen Reports
sources.notes: Investigates implementation of sanctions, arms embargo violations, illicit finance; includes detailed annexes.  Ingest as documents (sensitive).
Contains applied and bound tariffs; Yemen not WTO member but data may exist via Gulf Cooperation Council; treat as context.
Measures maritime connectivity; Yemen’s score can be used as proxy for trade facilitation and shipping disruptions.
May provide vehicle registrations for Yemen; relevant to transport sector.
Ranking of countries’ logistics performance; Yemen historically scored low; use as context.
Scholarly papers on trade and commerce in the Middle East; some on Yemen; ingest for narrative context.
Reports on intra‑OIC trade; may include Yemen’s trade ties with Islamic countries.

sources.nameEn: US Energy Information Administration (EIA) International Data
sources.notes: Provides country energy statistics: oil production/consumption, exports, CO₂ emissions; limited for Yemen but useful for global context.

sources.nameEn: BP Statistical Review of World Energy
sources.notes: Contains global energy production and consumption data; includes Yemen (oil production numbers).  *Check licensing.*
Provides detailed crude oil production by member countries; Yemen not a member but regionally relevant; can cross‑check supply.
International benchmark oil price; necessary for scenario modeling; license required for real‑time feed; use public index if available.

sources.nameEn: UN DP Partnership for Renewable Energy in Yemen
sources.notes: Documents renewable energy projects (solar micro‑grids); includes installation numbers and beneficiaries; parse for impact metrics.

sources.nameEn: University of Maryland Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS) – Energy Use
sources.notes: Provides microdata on household energy use from previous censuses; Yemen 2004 census microdata available; useful for baseline energy access.

sources.nameEn: World Bank Jobs Diagnostic for Yemen (2015)
sources.notes: Provides labour force statistics, unemployment rates, wages, and structural unemployment analysis; baseline before conflict.

sources.nameEn: UNDP Yemen Economic Resilience & Livelihoods Studies
sources.notes: Reports on cash-for-work programmes, livelihood outcomes; may include small datasets on job creation.
Reports on labour market dynamics in Arab region; may include Yemen; narrative but important context.
Contains data on mobile ownership and usage by gender; proxy for access to digital labour markets; may include Yemen via modelling.
Studies on youth not in employment, education or training (NEET), and demographic dividends.

sources.nameEn: The World Bank Global Wage Database
sources.notes: Contains wages/earnings but limited for Yemen; still note as potential source.
Large database of development finance; includes some Yemen projects with geolocation; can augment IATI/FTS; registration required.
Already in master registry; includes project titles, funding, status; integrate fully.

sources.nameEn: IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) Projects
sources.notes: Lists IFAD-funded projects (e.g., fisheries, irrigation, smallholder support); parse budgets and beneficiaries.
Contains approved and active projects in Yemen; extract funding amounts and sectors; licensing open.

sources.nameEn: USAID (US Agency for International Development) Assistance
sources.notes: Contains press releases and project summaries; budget info may be limited; complement IATI.
Provides funding allocations by sector; cross‑check with FTS; ingest as documents.

sources.nameEn: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre (KSrelief) Project Database
sources.notes: Lists aid projects financed by Saudi Arabia; includes budgets and sectors; incorporate for donor profiles.

sources.nameEn: Emirates Red Crescent & Other UAE Entities
sources.notes: Provides information on aid projects in Yemen; may not be comprehensive; glean from Arabic press and FTS cross‑references.
Aid programmes in Yemen; parse available information; treat with caution.
China-financed development projects; may involve ports/energy; gather announcements.
Lists German development and technical assistance projects in Yemen.
Contains small projects (health, water); parse details.

sources.nameEn: World Food Programme Project Pipeline (WFP OPS)
sources.notes: Detailed dataset of WFP’s operations, budgets, beneficiaries, and outputs; API available; cross‑link with Aid Tracker.
Lists humanitarian projects by organisation, cluster, geography; includes output metrics; integrate into geospatial viewer.
Provides data on water withdrawal, irrigation, and renewable water resources; may have Yemen entries; use for rural development analysis.
Joint analysis by FAO/WFP/FSAC; includes food basket cost, market integration, and IPC updates.
Reports on desert locust infestations and control operations; relevant for crop yields.
Data on fertiliser use; though Yemen-specific data may be limited; can use regional proxies.
Provides global cereals supply/demand and price outlook; used for context on import costs.

sources.nameEn: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) PSD Database
sources.notes: Commodity production, consumption and trade balances by country; includes Yemen for selected crops; check coverage.
Reports on school availability, enrolment, gender parity, infrastructure damage; includes small datasets.

sources.nameEn: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene
sources.notes: Provides estimates of access to drinking water, sanitation, hygiene services; includes Yemen; may rely on pre‑conflict surveys; still used as baseline.
Includes indicators on gender equality, women’s participation; limited for Yemen but informative.
Summarises people in need by sector and governorate; includes severity scores; narrative and some numeric tables; extract into data points.

sources.nameEn: The World Bank High Frequency Phone Surveys (Yemen)
sources.notes: Conducted to measure COVID‑19 impact on households; includes employment, income, food security; microdata available upon request.
Surveys measuring well‑being, perceptions of government, access to services; may include Yemen; subscription required.

sources.nameEn: GDELT Project (Global Database of Events, Language and Tone)
sources.notes: Provides automatically extracted events and tone from global media; can be filtered for Yemen; used as fallback if ACLED unavailable; treat as media‑derived and low confidence.
Contains incidents of terrorism worldwide; includes events in Yemen; may help contextualise conflict intensity.

sources.nameEn: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) Arms Transfers Database
sources.notes: Contains data on transfers of major weapons systems, including arms flows to parties in Yemen; informs sanctions/compliance modules.
Provides analysis of conflict dynamics; includes Yemen; subscription required; treat as narrative.
In-depth analyses of conflict dynamics, peace initiatives, economic impacts; narrative; ingest as documents.

sources.nameEn: World Peace Foundation “Political Economy of War” Dataset
sources.notes: Provides data and case studies on war economies; may include Yemen; useful for context.
Research papers on rent-seeking, wartime economies; includes Yemen case studies; narrative.
Provide shapefiles of roads, bridges, schools, health facilities; used for mapping infrastructure damage and coverage; license: ODbL (open).
Contains geolocated points of infrastructure damage (bridges, hospitals, schools) collected via satellite and field surveys.  Ingest as geospatial layer.
Lists UNOPS projects (roads, bridges, water systems) with budgets and completion status; vital for infrastructure module.
Already included; emphasise infrastructure subsector tags.

sources.nameEn: Humanitarian Logistics Cluster (Speed Restriction, Road Condition Reports)
sources.notes: Updates on road closures, damaged bridges, and alternate routes; ingest into timeline and map overlays.
Provides trends and statistics on foreign direct investment flows; includes regional context for Yemen; supplement UNCTADstat.
Provides investment promotion materials and data on licensed investment projects; seldom updated; treat with caution.

sources.nameEn: International Finance Corporation (IFC) Country Private Sector Diagnostic (CPSD)
sources.notes: Analytical documents assessing constraints and opportunities in private sector; includes Yemen; narrative.
Provides scenario analyses, risk bulletins and thematic briefs; narrative with contextual data; high credibility.
Produces policy papers, economic briefs and weekly updates; narrative; widely used by analysts.
Joint initiative producing policy briefs on banking, fuel subsidies, private sector; narrative.
Provides narrative and data on macroeconomic developments; official WBG perspective.

sources.nameEn: Chatham House Middle East & North Africa programme
sources.notes: Provides analysis on political economy, conflict drivers, humanitarian issues; narrative.
Papers on oil and gas markets; may include Yemen; narrative.
Papers on Yemen’s economy, governance, and geopolitical context.
Analytical articles; narrative.

sources.nameEn: World Bank’s Fragility, Conflict & Violence (FCV) Newsletter
sources.notes: Updates on FCV research; includes Yemen case studies; narrative.
For narrative updates on oil exports, currency, port operations; treat as information; cross‑verify.
Provides Arabic‑language news on Yemen’s economy; cross‑check.
Contains financial news and commentary; subscription for full access; treat as narrative.
Coverage on Yemen’s business and economy; narrative; cross‑verify.
Official news from both governments; use for announcements of policies, fuel price changes, etc.; treat with caution.
Provides investigative reports and commentary; narrative; cross‑check.
Provide NDVI/EVI values; used to track agricultural productivity and drought; aggregated to governorate level; open data.

sources.nameEn: CAMS (Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service) Air Quality and Dust Forecasts
sources.notes: Provides dust storm forecasts and air quality metrics (PM10, PM2.5) which can impact livelihoods and health; integrate if relevant.
Provides raster data on built‑up areas and population density; allows urban/rural comparisons.

sources.nameEn: SMAP (Soil Moisture Active Passive) Satellite Data
sources.notes: Measures soil moisture; can signal drought conditions; aggregated to region; open data.
Provides weather observations (temperature, precipitation) from local stations; Yemen coverage may be limited; use for climate context.
Provide rainfall estimates which affect crop production and flooding; open data.
Provides solar irradiation data; used for renewable energy investment planning; open data.
Offers proprietary forecasts for Yemen’s GDP, inflation, exchange rate, etc.  *Needs Key/License* – store metadata only.
Provides parallel market exchange rates and financial news; cannot be scraped.  Use only if license allows; otherwise mark as unavailable.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Central Statistical Office Population Projections
sources.urlRaw: CSO reports (access via CSO or UNFPA)
sources.notes: Provides national and governorate population estimates; used by UN agencies.  Tag regime accordingly.
May release official commodity price lists or inflation updates; scarce due to conflict.  Ingest if available.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Petroleum Company (YPC) Official Fuel Prices
sources.notes: Official pump prices in Sana’a (DFA) published on YPC’s channels; must track via scraping or partner submissions.

sources.nameEn: Government of Yemen (Aden) Fuel Price Announcements
sources.notes: Announced by Ministry of Oil or other agencies; used to set official prices in IRG-controlled areas.

sources.nameEn: Abdul Wahab Shukri FX Market Bulletin
sources.notes: Informal bulletins by major money exchangers quoting market rates; may become part of partner feed; treat as anecdotal and store with low confidence.
Some Yemeni banks publish daily exchange rates (buy/sell).  Scrape or partner feed; assign regime tag.
An app used by Yemeni traders posting parallel market rates; data may be accessible via API or manual capture; mark as low confidence.

sources.nameEn: Central Bank of Yemen Sana’a Official Rate
sources.notes: Official rate in DFA; glean from Ministry of Finance bulletins or speeches.

sources.nameEn: UN Commodity Trade Statistics (UNSD) for Mirror Trade
sources.notes: Import/export of arms category; can be used to detect arms shipments (if any recorded).
Provide lists of licensed banks, branch openings, sector concerns; documentation may be found via local press; ingest into stakeholder profiles.
Statistics on active borrowers, portfolio outstanding, portfolio at risk, by MFI; if partners share dataset; treat as sensitive; tag regime.

sources.nameEn: Al Kuraimi Islamic Bank Annual Reports
sources.notes: Provide financial statements (assets, deposits, profit) and branch network; parse for insights; may contain credit risk indicators.
If accessible via partners; includes financial data of major companies (oil, telecoms, manufacturing); sensitive; store metadata with caution.

sources.urlRaw: Ministry of Industry & Trade or CBY lists
sources.notes: Lists of authorised money exchangers; glean from circulars and partner organisations; necessary for stakeholder pages.
Government and multilateral pledges for Yemen; capture announcements (e.g. Saudi Arabia, UAE, USA).

sources.nameEn: Yemen Petroleum Company Fuel Subsidy Statements
sources.notes: Announcements on subsidy adjustments; feed into subsidy tracker.
May contain customs collection figures; scarce; treat as low confidence.
Collects public finance laws, budgets, tax decrees; vital for legal library.

sources.nameEn: Port of Aden & Port of Mukalla Throughput Reports
sources.notes: Data on container and cargo volumes handled by southern ports; glean from port authority websites or local media.

sources.nameEn: Dubai Ports World (DP World) Trade Reports
sources.notes: DP World manages Aden port; reports may contain Yemen trade throughput; treat as secondary.

sources.urlRaw: Ministry of Industry & Trade, press releases
sources.notes: Document lists of authorised importers/exporters; may help track commodity flows; scarce.

sources.nameEn: SAECA (Yemen Supreme Authority for Economic & Corporate Affairs)
sources.notes: If revived, may publish commercial regulations; currently dormant.  Placeholder for future.
Contains lists of applied tariffs by HS code; needed for trade policy analysis; may be outdated.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Ministry of Oil & Minerals / Safer Exploration & Production Company
sources.notes: Data on oil output, refinery operations, revenue sharing between Aden and Sana’a; highly politicised; glean via news.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Diesel & LPG Demand Reports (if any)
sources.urlRaw: Logistics cluster or Ministry of Oil
sources.notes: Provide estimates of fuel demand; cross‑check with WFP fuel price bulletins.
Announces LPG cylinder prices and distribution schedules; important for cost of living analysis.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Ministry of Social Affairs and Labour (MoSAL)
sources.notes: May provide information on minimum wage, labour regulations; seldom published; glean via local media.

sources.nameEn: Private sector surveys (e.g., Tadhamon Bank SME survey)
sources.notes: Surveys of SMEs on workforce, wages, skills; often part of project evaluations; need partner access.

sources.urlRaw: Already included; emphasise cereals & livestock series
sources.notes: Pre‑2013 official data; update for proxies if available.
Provide production volumes by crop, area cultivated; mostly outdated; treat as historical baseline.

sources.nameEn: Crops and Livestock Integrated Survey (if revived)
sources.urlRaw: Household survey via CSO or FAO
sources.notes: Last survey pre‑2014; should be added if new rounds conducted post‑conflict; treat as potential.
Provide number of Yemeni refugees abroad and refugees in Yemen.

sources.nameEn: International Organization for Migration (IOM) Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)
sources.notes: Provide counts of internally displaced persons, returnees, and migrant arrivals by governorate.
Detailed dataset on insurgent and terrorist attacks; expensive; mark as *Needs Key*.

sources.nameEn: United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics (Comtrade) for Arms (HS 9304)
sources.notes: Import/export of arms category; can be used to detect arms shipments (if any recorded).
Provide names of individuals/entities under sanctions; see master registry.

sources.nameEn: U.S. OFAC Specially Designated Nationals List
sources.notes: Provide names of Yemeni entities under US sanctions.
Provide names under EU/UK sanctions regimes.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Ministry of Interior & Ministry of Defence (Aden & Sana’a)
sources.notes: Provide casualty reports and conflict updates; seldom reliable; treat as narrative.
Provide counts of airstrikes and civilian casualties; high credibility.

sources.nameEn: Yemen Telecom Companies Data (Yemen Mobile, Sabafon, MTN, Y-Telecom)
sources.notes: Provide information on subscriber numbers, network coverage, restoration of services; glean via press releases.
Provide updates on electricity supply, power plant repairs, load shedding; glean from local news; treat as narrative.
Provide updates on cross‑border investments by Gulf and Yemeni expatriates; glean from media or business associations.
Could provide data on non‑oil exports, SME exporters; currently inactive; placeholder.
See above.
Reports on Yemen’s economy, politics, forecast; subscription required; store metadata only; *Needs Key*.

sources.nameEn: World Bank Open Data – Indicators API
sources.accessMethod: Direct API (open, no key required); JSON or XML responses
sources.updateFrequency: Monthly for many series (WDI quarterly/annually per indicator release); continuous as data published
sources.license: Open Data – CC BY 4.0; free to use with attribution
sources.typicalLagText: Low to moderate – data appears soon after source release
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector; paginate results; daily/weekly checks; retries on failure; Data Gap Ticket if unresolved
sources.yetoUsage: Core macro database for dashboards (GDP, prices, finance); baseline for Scenario Simulator, FX Dashboard, Aid Tracker; glossary definitions; regional peer comparisons
sources.yetoModule: Macro Trends, Governance, Scenario Simulator, Data Explorer API, Methodology
sources.granularityCaveats: National-level aggregates; annual/quarterly/monthly series; no subnational data; gaps during conflict years or modelled estimates; alternative sources used when missing; gaps flagged as “Not available”

sources.urlRaw: https://sdmx.imf.org/rest/data/ (IFS, DOTS, GFS) and PDFs for Article IV reports
sources.accessMethod: API for structured data (SDMX/XML/JSON – some datasets require registration); PDFs for Article IV and country reports
sources.updateFrequency: Quarterly for most IMF datasets (some monthly series); Article IV reports annually or biennially
sources.license: Open data (IMF open data initiative); attribution required; some datasets require registration
sources.typicalLagText: Moderate – quarterly data appear after a few months; Article IV reports several months after mission; gaps due to conflict
dataFields: value; Article IV PDFs contain tables and narrative
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector for SDMX with frequency handling and versioning; Document ingestion for PDFs (extract tables, store metadata); retries and Data Gap Ticket on failure
sources.yetoUsage: Complement World Bank macro data (monetary & external sector); FX Dashboard (official rates, reserves), Public Finance module (fiscal projections), Scenario Simulator (baseline forecasts), Research Hub (Article IV commentary)
sources.yetoModule: Macro Trends, Financial Sector, Public Finance, Scenario Simulator, Document Library, Glossary
sources.granularityCaveats: National-level annual/quarterly data; no governorate detail; large gaps post‑2015; IMF staff estimates fill gaps (lower confidence); “Not available – see proxy” when not reported

sources.accessMethod: Direct API (JSON or CSV); free for moderate use; registration needed for heavy use; bulk downloads available
sources.updateFrequency: Monthly/annual – updated as countries report (mirror data for Yemen due to limited reporting)
sources.license: Open for non-commercial use with attribution; rate limits apply
sources.typicalLagText: High – annual totals appear 6–12 months after year‑end; monthly data lags a few months
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector retrieves annual trade data in batches (by year or chapter); store detailed series; fallback to UNCTADstat or offline CSV if API unavailable; retries and Data Gap Ticket when missing
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Trade Dashboard (import/export trends, top commodities, trade balance); Scenario Simulator (external sector shocks); Aid Tracker (aid vs trade context); Stakeholder Pages (trade ties)
sources.yetoModule: Trade & Commerce, Macro Trends (trade % GDP), Regional Comparison
sources.granularityCaveats: National totals by commodity/partner; no subnational data; gaps filled with mirror data; undercounts informal trade; missing data flagged; fallback offline if needed

sources.accessMethod: REST API (JSON/CSV) with API key; bulk downloads available
sources.updateFrequency: Annual; some modeled estimates more frequent
sources.license: Open data with attribution; API token required
sources.typicalLagText: High – data often a couple years old
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector scheduled to fetch latest data; fallback to CSV; Data Gap Ticket if missing; modelled data flagged
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Social Indicators – unemployment trends, labor force size; informs Scenario Simulator and Stakeholder pages
sources.yetoModule: Macro/Social Trends, Research Hub, Glossary
sources.granularityCaveats: National, annual; no subnational labor data; post-2015 data are estimates with lower confidence; YETO notes discrepancies between sources

sources.accessMethod: REST API (JSON) – no key needed; filter by country, year, appeal
sources.license: Open data; usage per OCHA terms; attribution required
sources.typicalLagText: Low – new contributions appear within days
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector scheduled daily; aggregates data; links flows to HRP documents; retries and Data Gap Ticket on failure; manual CSV fallback
sources.yetoUsage: Powers Aid Tracker – total funding, donor rankings, sector allocations, funding gaps; Stakeholder pages; scenario modeling; research grounding for AI
sources.yetoModule: Aid Funding Dashboard, Donor Profiles, Cluster/Sector Pages, Crisis Timeline, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Country-level flows; subnational earmarking not well captured; double-counting possible; cross-checked with IATI; duplicates flagged

sources.accessMethod: REST API and bulk CSV exports; no auth
sources.updateFrequency: Continuous – organizations publish updates on their schedule; datastore updates daily or weekly
sources.license: Open data (CC BY); publishers may have additional terms; attribution required
sources.typicalLagText: Varies – depends on publisher (real-time to annual)
sources.ingestionMethod: API/ETL hybrid – weekly ingestion via datastore API; uses filters and bulk downloads; data stored relationally; missing fields flagged; attempts to enrich from docs; gap tickets for under-reporting
sources.yetoUsage: Complements FTS – provides project-level detail; populates Aid Project Explorer and Stakeholder pages; used in Aid Tracker to show outputs and link to outcomes; research hub; scenario modeling
sources.yetoModule: Aid Projects Dashboard, Stakeholder Profiles, Geospatial Viewer, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Project-level; some geocodes; many entries only country-level; not all donors publish; under-coverage flagged; FTS or donor reports used to fill gaps

sources.accessMethod: REST API – no key (app name parameter for usage tracking)
sources.license: Open access to metadata; content may have separate copyrights; respect original source rights; do not republish full content without permission
sources.typicalLagText: Minimal – items appear as soon as published and indexed
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector runs daily to fetch new reports; stores metadata and full text/excerpt; content indexed for search; tags captured; manual processing for large/scanned PDFs
sources.yetoUsage: Populates Research Hub library; provides evidence and context; used by AI assistant for citations; feeds Timeline module; includes WFP bulletins, UN updates, ACAPS reports
sources.yetoModule: Research Hub Library, Interactive Timeline, AI Chat, Glossary, Stakeholder Pages
sources.granularityCaveats: Narrative info; some subnational details in text; PDF/scan may require OCR; flagged for manual processing if extraction fails

sources.urlRaw: UNHCR: https://api.unhcr.org/population/v1/ ; IOM DTM reports via HDX
sources.accessMethod: UNHCR API (open, no auth) for refugee/IDP counts; IOM DTM datasets via reports/CSV (manual)
sources.updateFrequency: UNHCR annual; IOM DTM quarterly or as needed
sources.license: Public/open data; use with attribution
sources.typicalLagText: UNHCR annual (yearly); IOM quarterly
dataFields: value; IOM: IDP/returnee/migrant counts by region
sources.ingestionMethod: API ingestion from UNHCR for refugee data; manual ETL for IOM DTM spreadsheets; Data Gap Ticket if new events occur or updates missing
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Humanitarian Overview (displacement stats); IDP trends; maps; stakeholder pages (UNHCR, IOM)
sources.yetoModule: Humanitarian Dashboard, IDP trends chart, Maps, Stakeholder Pages
sources.granularityCaveats: UNHCR national; IOM subnational; data collection challenging in conflict zones; figures are estimates; IDP counts vary across sources and may require cross-checking

sources.accessMethod: REST API with token or bulk CSV downloads (license required)
sources.license: ACLED data © ACLED; non-commercial use with attribution; license required; show disclaimer
sources.typicalLagText: Low – events added within 1–2 weeks
sources.ingestionMethod: Conditional API connector – automated weekly pulls if licensed; data stored as sensitive; filtered/aggregated for display; fallback to other sources (e.g. UCDP, GDELT) if license unavailable; Data Gap Ticket if no access
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Conflict Timeline; allows correlation with economic indicators; informs AI Assistant; maps and heatmaps; stakeholder pages for security actors; sanctions/compliance
sources.yetoModule: Interactive Timeline, Maps, AI evidence, Conflict overview, Sanctions/Compliance
sources.granularityCaveats: Highly granular (village-level events); fatalities are estimates; ACLED not official casualty count; sensitive data; display as overlay optional; fallback to UCDP or GDELT if ACLED not available

sources.updateFrequency: Annual version releases (data up to previous year)
sources.license: Free for research with attribution
sources.typicalLagText: High – annual release covers up to previous year
sources.ingestionMethod: API connector fetches annual entries; loads into time-series; stores version number; cross-check with ACLED; Data Gap Ticket if missing updates
sources.yetoUsage: Provides macro view of conflict fatalities; feeds dashboards; scenario modeling; AI Assistant reference; cross-check with ACLED
sources.yetoModule: Conflict Overview, Timeline, Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: Annual national-level aggregates; slower updates; undercounts recent events; complementary to ACLED; flagged accordingly

sources.institution: United Nations, OFAC (US Treasury), EU, UK (HM Treasury)
sources.urlRaw: UN: https://scsanctions.un.org/resources/xml/en/consolidated.xml ; OFAC: CSV/XML on treas.gov ; EU & UK: PDF/CSV from respective sites
sources.updateFrequency: Ad‑hoc (whenever designations change); OFAC daily; EU/UK as needed
sources.license: Public domain (legal notices); informational use only (not legal advice)
sources.typicalLagText: None – updates available as soon as lists change
sources.ingestionMethod: Automated import of CSV/XML; schedule daily for OFAC and weekly for UN/EU/UK; parse entries; filter those linked to Yemen; track updates (added/removed); update compliance database; manual fix if format changes
sources.yetoUsage: Sanctions & Compliance overview module – shows sanctioned entities; Stakeholder pages display warnings; AI compliance Q&A; timeline of sanctions events; compliance risk scoring
sources.yetoModule: Sanctions Dashboard, Stakeholder profiles, AI Compliance Q&A, Timeline
sources.granularityCaveats: Lists are global (no subnational); not legal advice; show disclaimer; must update promptly; maintain reliability; note duplicates across lists

sources.urlRaw: UNCTADstat bulk download (no open API) – e.g. FDI inflows, external debt, current account
sources.accessMethod: Manual/semi-automated CSV/Excel download; registration may be required for bulk files
sources.license: Free for use with attribution (public)
sources.typicalLagText: Moderate to high (6+ months after year‑end)
sources.ingestionMethod: Custom ETL – periodic checks for new files, download CSVs, load into structured tables; validation on year‑over‑year consistency; Data Gap Ticket if updates missing
sources.yetoUsage: External sector enrichment – FDI trends, debt statistics; complement trade data
sources.yetoModule: Macro Trends (external debt, FDI), Investment Dashboard, Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: National, annual; gaps due to conflict; proxies used if missing; flagged with lower confidence

sources.urlRaw: FAOSTAT portal (bulk downloads); FAO Food Price Index; food security cluster bulletins
sources.accessMethod: Bulk download (CSV/Excel) – no API; bulletins (PDF) for food price monitoring
sources.updateFrequency: Annual for production indices; periodic (monthly/quarterly) for price monitoring
sources.license: Open data (CC BY 4.0)
sources.typicalLagText: High for production (published 1+ year later); moderate for price data
sources.ingestionMethod: Custom ETL – ingest historical series from FAOSTAT; parse PDF bulletins for food price monitoring; cross-validate with WFP; Data Gap alerts if bulletins are late
sources.yetoUsage: Agricultural context – agriculture % of GDP, cereal production trends; food price data used for humanitarians and inflation proxy
sources.yetoModule: Macro Trends (agriculture), Markets & Prices, Aid & Food Security, Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: National totals; no governorate-level production data; significant data gaps post‑2015; proxies used and missing values flagged

sources.urlRaw: Various: UNDP Yemen site, UNICEF Yemen site, WFP VAM DataViz, OCHA HDX datasets
sources.accessMethod: Documents (PDFs) and small datasets; some via HDX; manual or semi-automated ingestion
sources.updateFrequency: Occasional – e.g. UNDP bulletins quarterly, UNICEF updates annually, WFP VAM price bulletins monthly, OCHA HNO/HRP annually
sources.license: Public domain or CC BY (varies by agency); data on HDX open
sources.typicalLagText: Reports often 1–2 times per year; data may be a few months old
dataFields: number of out‑of‑school children) and narrative analysis
sources.ingestionMethod: Document ingestion with parsing; YETO captures key data points and stores metadata; manual entry if automated parsing fails; Data Gap if expected reports are overdue
sources.yetoUsage: Enriches Evidence Base; feeds Scenario Simulator assumptions; informs dashboards (e.g. needs and aid coverage, malnutrition rates); used in Glossary; Research Hub and AI assistant
sources.yetoModule: Humanitarian Overview, Poverty & Social Indicators, Research Hub, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Some reports include subnational data (needs by governorate); captured by YETO; data may be modelled or inconsistent; flagged with confidence rating and methodology notes

sources.urlRaw: WFP VAM DataViz platform and HDX (e.g. monthly bulletins like “Yemen Market and Trade Bulletin Oct 2025”)
sources.accessMethod: PDF bulletins and CSV/Excel datasets; WFP price API if available; manual ingestion
sources.updateFrequency: Monthly bulletins (4–6 week lag); possibly bi‑weekly raw price data
sources.license: Open; WFP data is public with attribution
sources.typicalLagText: 4–6 weeks – bulletins published after month end; raw data available sooner via partners
dataFields: date; cost of minimum food basket; fuel prices; exchange rates
sources.ingestionMethod: Custom parser to extract tables from monthly PDFs; ingest any available CSV from HDX; manual QA; WFP global price API if available; Data Gap alert if bulletin is late
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Markets Dashboard (price trends, regional splits), Fuel Price Dashboard, FX Dashboard (market rates), Scenario Simulator (impact of shocks), AI assistant (inflation and purchasing power)
sources.yetoModule: FX & Inflation Monitor, Food Security panel, Humanitarian Planning, Timeline
sources.granularityCaveats: Subnational – data by region/market; YETO labels regime control (GoY vs DFA); no official CPI post‑2015; WFP price-based inflation is proxy; volatile; missing areas noted
tags: Market Prices & Food Security;FX & Inflation Monitor

sources.institution: Yemeni fuel companies, humanitarian clusters, partners
sources.urlRaw: Varies – YPC announcements, Food Security Cluster Fuel Watch, partner data contributions
sources.accessMethod: Manual ingestion – PDF bulletins, social media announcements, partner-provided files
sources.updateFrequency: Ad‑hoc (whenever price changes); clusters track monthly
sources.license: Public domain or partner data; provenance maintained
sources.typicalLagText: N/A – updates as changes occur; YETO records time of last change
sources.ingestionMethod: Custom pipeline; maintain dataset of fuel prices; ingest updates from WFP/clusters; use media monitoring; store multiple prices (official vs unofficial) with provenance; manual updates when automated data is sparse; Data Gap Ticket on conflicting or missing data
sources.yetoUsage: Supports inflation/cost of living analysis; macro dashboards; Fuel Subsidy Tracker; scenario modelling; stakeholder pages; sanctions/compliance (if tracking fuel import violations)
sources.yetoModule: Markets & Prices, Fuel Subsidy Tracker (if implemented), Timeline, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Regional (north vs south and city‑level); official price may not reflect availability; multiple prices recorded (official and market); context noted; manual updates recommended when data scarce

sources.accessMethod: Manual ingestion from monthly reports and media releases
sources.license: Attribution required; data for advocacy; not for commercial use
sources.typicalLagText: Low – monthly data available within next month
sources.ingestionMethod: Manual parsing of reports and bulletins; store monthly counts; integrate into conflict timeline; Data Gap Ticket if missing reports
sources.yetoUsage: Enhances Conflict Timeline (air war intensity); AI Assistant; Sanctions/Compliance (air strike patterns relevant to arms embargo); scenario modeling
sources.yetoModule: Conflict Timeline, AI evidence, Sanctions/Compliance, Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: Monthly by broad region; covers only airstrikes; complementary to ACLED; flagged as specific context

sources.nameEn: Central Bank of Yemen – Aden & Sana’a
sources.institution: Central Bank of Yemen (CBY) – Aden (Government) & Sana’a (De facto)
sources.urlRaw: Official websites (e.g. cby-aden.com); Sana’a releases via Ministry of Planning or news
sources.accessMethod: Manual ingestion – scrape CBY Aden auction data, bulletins; glean Sana’a data from reports/leaks/news; partner feeds
sources.updateFrequency: Aden: weekly FX auction results; monthly/quarterly bulletins; annual financial statements. Sana’a: irregular data via budget docs or news; circulars occasionally
sources.license: Government public data (no formal license)
sources.typicalLagText: Variable – auctions weekly; other stats months or absent
dataFields: weighted rate; FX rates; monetary aggregates; list of licensed banks; circulars and policy decisions
sources.ingestionMethod: Custom ETL and document parsing – scheduled scraping of CBY Aden auction results; parse bulletins and financial statements; tag data by regime (Aden vs Sana’a); store parallel series; Data Gap for missing series; proxies used (e.g. WFP prices for inflation)
sources.yetoUsage: FX Dashboard (official vs parallel rates); Monetary module (money supply, inflation, banking sector); Public Finance context; Stakeholder Pages (CBY profile); timeline for monetary policy events
sources.yetoModule: FX & Monetary, Banking Sector, Public Finance, Timeline, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: National; effectively two monetary jurisdictions; YETO displays dual values; data quality low; proxies used; missing data flagged; contradictory series shown side-by-side

sources.nameEn: Yemen Ministry of Finance / Ministry of Planning / CSO
sources.urlRaw: Official documents (budgets, fiscal statements) via government portals or leaked PDFs
sources.accessMethod: Manual document ingestion (PDFs, Excel); partner-provided copies; speech extracts
sources.updateFrequency: GoY budgets irregular (e.g. 2019, 2021); execution reports rarely; Sana’a budgets undisclosed; MoPIC plans occasional; CSO yearbooks up to 2014 and limited later estimates
sources.license: Government data; public domain
sources.typicalLagText: Annual if published; many years missing
dataFields: Budget lines by sector/ministry; revenue by type (oil
grants); deficit & financing; population and CPI series; macro assumptions; development plan indicators
sources.ingestionMethod: Document parsing and ETL – extract tables from PDFs; store data by regime and year; flag missing years; glean partial data from speeches and IMF reports; integrate CSO historical data; Data Gap Ticket when reports unavailable; proxies used
sources.yetoUsage: Public Finance module – budget trends, revenues, expenditures, debt; Debt Tracker; scenario modelling (fiscal policy changes); Stakeholder pages for MoF/MoPIC; Research library
sources.yetoModule: Public Finance Dashboard, Debt Tracker, Economic Plans, Research library, Stakeholder Pages
sources.granularityCaveats: National; breakdown by sector if available; no unified budget after 2015; data politicized; off‑budget items (e.g. military aid) excluded; data rated low confidence; side‑by‑side comparison of GoY vs DFA budgets
tags: Public Finance & Economic Planning;Public Finance Dashboard

sources.urlRaw: SFD website (annual reports, project catalogs); some data via IATI
sources.accessMethod: Document ingestion; partner data sharing via CSV/excel; IATI feed if available
sources.updateFrequency: Annual reports; continuous updates in internal MIS (not public)
sources.license: Public reports open; detailed data via partnership/MoU
sources.typicalLagText: Annual summary available few months after year‑end; detailed updates require access
sources.ingestionMethod: Document ingestion & custom feed – parse annual reports for aggregates; if partnership, ingest CSV; link with IATI (activities listing SFD as implementer); Data Gap if no data available
sources.yetoUsage: Showcases community-level impact; Aid Tracker highlights SFD activities; Stakeholder page describes SFD role; contributes to Poverty & Resilience module; microfinance data used in Financial Sector analysis
sources.yetoModule: Aid Projects, Poverty & Resilience, Stakeholder Profile, Private Sector (microfinance data)
sources.granularityCaveats: Subnational – data by district/village; funding sources must be merged to avoid double counting; security conditions may stall projects; missing details flagged

sources.accessMethod: PDF reports; partner data sharing (no API)
sources.license: Shared within development community; open if obtained
sources.typicalLagText: Unknown – likely annual consolidation
sources.ingestionMethod: Manual/partner ETL – import baseline dataset (e.g. banks_microfinance_money_exchangers.xlsx); request quarterly data from network; search for publications; use SFD data for microfinance; Data Gap when updates missing
sources.yetoUsage: Feeds Financial Sector module – microfinance outreach and resilience; Stakeholder pages for MFIs; AI Assistant uses microfinance stats; scenario modelling for financial inclusion
sources.yetoModule: Finance Dashboard, Maps (branch coverage), Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: National; governorate-level if provided; conflict impacts MFIs; data may be outdated; flagged with caveats; north vs south splits after 2015

sources.urlRaw: N/A – statements or annual meeting documents
dataFields: N/A (qualitative; uses other sources for quantitative figures)
sources.ingestionMethod: Maintain stakeholder profile; rely on other sources for quantitative data; document statements
sources.yetoUsage: Stakeholder page for AYB; potential channel for data requests; context for banking sector
sources.yetoModule: Stakeholder Map, Compliance
sources.granularityCaveats: Not a data source; used for qualitative context and stakeholder engagement

sources.institution: Federation of Yemeni Chambers of Commerce & Industry; business associations
sources.accessMethod: Surveys/reports from chambers; customs data via chamber if shared
sources.license: N/A; survey-based data
sources.ingestionMethod: Treat as stakeholder; engage to obtain surveys; manually ingest if available
sources.yetoUsage: Enrich Private Sector module (business sentiment, logistics challenges); scenario assumptions for private investment; Research hub
sources.yetoModule: Private Sector Module, Scenario Simulator, Research Hub
sources.granularityCaveats: Data is anecdotal, not systematic; Data Gap likely; flagged as such

sources.urlRaw: NOAA/NASA Nighttime Lights data (monthly composites via Earth Observation portals)
sources.accessMethod: Bulk file download (GeoTIFF); processing to extract indices; possible use of Google Earth Engine
sources.license: Open (US government data)
sources.typicalLagText: ~1 month after end of month
sources.ingestionMethod: Data pipeline – fetch monthly raster, compute summary metrics (e.g. total luminosity by governorate); filter anomalies; store time series; Data Gap if retrieval fails
sources.yetoUsage: Economic activity proxy on macro dashboard; scenario modeling (recovery scenarios); interactive maps; timeline overlays
sources.yetoModule: Macro Trends, Energy & Infrastructure, Interactive Maps, Timeline
sources.granularityCaveats: Granularity ~0.5 km aggregated; proxies require interpretation; anomalies from fires or flaring; not direct GDP measure; flagged as experimental indicator

sources.license: Public reports; usage with attribution; content may be under CC BY
sources.typicalLagText: N/A – publishes as events require
sources.ingestionMethod: Document ingestion; store reports in Research Hub; no structured data extraction except manual summarization
sources.yetoUsage: Provides qualitative context in Research Hub; informs Scenario Simulator; AI assistant uses narrative insights
sources.yetoModule: Scenario Simulator (pre‑modelled scenarios), Research Hub, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Narrative analysis; not structured data; used for context not metrics

sources.license: Public reports; usage with attribution
sources.typicalLagText: N/A – as published
sources.ingestionMethod: Document ingestion; store in Research Hub; manual extraction of bespoke data
sources.yetoUsage: Enriches Glossary (definitions with Yemen context); informs Research Library; supports AI assistant responses; Stakeholder pages may link relevant briefs
sources.yetoModule: Research Hub, Glossary, Stakeholder Pages, AI Assistant
sources.granularityCaveats: Narrative analysis; not systematic data; used for context and definitions
